The Alliance For Democratic Szamara or ADS is an international organization and military alliance. Formed initially to provide mutual defence against the Socialist Friendship Convention, it has expended its purpose to promote democracy, free trade and international cooperation against organized crime and terrorism.

History

Background

The collapse of the Malaszec and Urendin Empires saw a rapid transformation of the world order. The industrial revolution gave birth not only to an unprecedented era of economical growth but also of communist ideology which saw a meteoric rise with the Malaszec revolution in 1932. The fear of a communist empire under Malaszec lead to proposals of a counter-alliance among Urendin politicians already in the 1930s but the chaos of the revolution and the Dwerchus War put developments on hold.

Formation and Early Years

Post Cold War

Goals and Purpose

The foremost goal of the ADS has from the very start been to protect representative democracy, free enterprise, private property and sapient rights among member statates.
